definition: window/opening providing restricted access (e.g. customer service window)/computer operating system window/fig. medium/intermediary/showpiece/testing ground
car window/window of vehicle (bus, train etc)
(of a plot etc) to be exposed (idiom)/to come to light
window with an iron grating (apartment etc)/barred window of a prison cell

sentences.english: I closed the window. I combed his long, black hair from his forehead.
sentences.chinese: 我關上窗，爲他梳理了額頭長長的黑髮。

sentences.english: Transit vehicle routing problem with time intervals-constrained is considered.
sentences.chinese: 提出了具有時間窗的貨物運輸車輛路徑問題。

sentences.english: I realized there was no fog veiling my window.
sentences.chinese: 我意識到，我的窗沒有被雲霧遮蔽。

sentences.english: Staring through the window, I saw the snake like lighting crawling on the gray and heavy sky.
sentences.chinese: 透過窗，只見那電蛇在黑沉沉的天空蜿蜒。

sentences.english: I am now at a very pleasant cottage window looking onto a beautiful hilly country, with a view of the sea.
sentences.chinese: 我正愜意地臨窗而坐，眺望遠山如黛，碧海連天。

sentences.english: Through the window, quietly enjoy the sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 透過窗，靜靜的享受那一縷陽光。

sentences.english: Or at the casement seen her stand?
sentences.chinese: 可有誰見過她站在窗後？

sentences.english: But if you\'re like me, my humanity is more like a window.
sentences.chinese: 但是如果你們像我一樣，我的人性更像一扇窗。

sentences.english: If God were to close the door on you, He would leave a window open.
sentences.chinese: 上帝爲你關了這扇門必會爲你再開一口窗。

sentences.english: Soft rain is knocking at the red window.
Realise this deeply, carry it in your heart when you walk the world.
sentences.chinese: 要透徹地領悟到這一點，在你窗蕩世界時銘記於心。

sentences.english: If at all possible, choose a room with a great east facing window.
sentences.chinese: 如果可以的話，就選一間窗朝東向的房間。

sentences.english: The window resisted all efforts to open it.
sentences.chinese: 這扇窗怎麼用勁也打不開。

sentences.english: The invention can be widely applicable to various glass lift window waterproof horizontal rail.
sentences.chinese: 本發明可廣泛適用於各種玻璃升降窗的橫攔防水。

sentences.english: Doors are a necessity, whereas windows are more or less a luxury.
sentences.chinese: 門是住屋子者的需要，窗多少是一種奢侈。

sentences.english: His roommate’s bed was tightly close to the window, while he could only lie in bed all day long.
sentences.chinese: 病友的牀緊靠着窗，而他只能終日平躺在牀上。

definition: window/the opening panel of a window
variant of 百葉窗|百叶窗[bai3 ye4 chuang1]
window/opening providing restricted access (e.g. customer service window)/computer operating system window/fig. medium/intermediary/showpiece/testing ground
car window/window of vehicle (bus, train etc)

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
door/the opening panel of a door
hanging screen/curtain over shop door (for privacy and serving as advertisement)
